qas.question: When was the first British patent for the use of bitumen?
When did Richard Tappin Claridge patent asphalt for use in pavement?
Where had Claridge previously seen asphalt used as pavement?
What type of pavement techniques had already been tried by a competitor of Claridge?
What friend of Claridge's was helpful in introducing asphalt for use in pavements?
In what year was Cassell's patent France or Belgium issued?
The second patent, Cassell's patent, was issued in which year?
On what day did Claridge's patent #5309 patent the use of Seyssel asphalt?
In 1845 Richard Tappin Claridge patented the use of what?
When was the second British patent for using bitumen issued?

context: The first British patent for the use of asphalt/bitumen was 'Cassell's patent asphalte or bitumen' in <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0><b9_0>1834<b9_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>. Then on <a1_0><b7_0>25 November 1837<b7_0/><a1_0/>, Richard Tappin Claridge patented the use of <b8_0>Seyssel asphalt<b8_0/> (patent #7849), for use in asphalte pavement, having seen it employed in <a2_0>France and Belgium<a2_0/> when visiting with Frederick Walter Simms, who worked with him on the introduction of asphalt to Britain. Dr T. Lamb Phipson writes that his father, <a4_0>Samuel Ryland Phipson<a4_0/>, a friend of Claridge, was also "instrumental in introducing the asphalte pavement (in 1836)". Indeed, <a3_0>mastic<a3_0/> pavements had been previously employed at Vauxhall by a competitor of Claridge, but without success.
